citation.article-title: Desulforhabdus amnigenus gen. nov. sp. nov., a sulfate reducer isolated from anaerobic granular sludge.

p.s: Description of Desulforhabdus amnigenus sp. nov.
Desulforhabdus amnigenus (Am.ni'ge.nus. L. masc. n. amnis water; L. neut. n. genus origin; L. adj. amnigenus coming from water.)
Cells are rod-shaped-to-ellipsoidal, 1.4-1.9 x 2.5-3.4 μm, occurring singly, in pairs, or in long chains.
Cells grow autotrophically with H2, CO2, and sulfate.
Acetate and other compounds are completely oxidized to CO2.
Sulfate, sulfite, thiosulfate, and dithionite serve as electron acceptors.
The optimum pH is 7.2-7.6; the optimum temperature is 37 °C.
Growth is optimal in freshwater medium.
The G+C content of the DNA is 52.5 mol%.
Habitat is granular sludge from an upflow anaerobic sludge bed (UASB) reactor treating sulfate-rich wastewater.
